str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Tertullus, a barrister acting as professional prosecutor of Paul at Caesarea. Of uncertain derivation; Tertullus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To accuse, charge, prosecute. From kategoros; to be a plaintiff, i.e. To charge with some offence.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) gen: I obtain, (b) absol: I chance, happen; ordinary, everyday, it may chance, perhaps.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 2nd Person Singular
str2: Yours, thy, thine. From su; thine.
Forethought, foresight, provision for, providence. From pronoeo; forethought, i.e. Provident care or supply.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From a compound of dia and a derivative of orthos, meaning to straighten thoroughly; rectification, i.e. the Messianic restauration.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
